author: Adrian Kessel
comment: Has every feature I've been looking for.  This is a comprehensive app to move media from phone to Android Wear. The estimated transfer time is a nice touch.  It isn't super intuitive to use but I got the hang of it after a few minutes. It isn't the prettiest app ever but no big deal.  My nitpick would be that when playing back audio on Android Wear it does not respond to pause/play commands from my headphones like every other app seems to do. This would be nice to see added.

author: rusty gh
comment: Fantastic! The simple fact alone that this slams google for having such a crappy app, makes it A++ Here is what I use, on this app that works. Move music files to music folder, and use music player to play on the watch. google wants me to upload to their player, or join a subscription. No way. This app does what I need. Con: transfer is a bit slow, I think that is a hardware issue, cause this developer writes a great app, I can deal with a little slow transfer for each song one time.

author: Simon Johnstone
comment: Free version had way to many ads forcing one to upgrade to pay version which should be reported to Google.  The app works but is very slow, about 120KBS even on WiFi.  However when copying files, it does not recognize ones already copied, so the transfer then takes much longer.   Could and should be great, but is let down on greed and lack of functionality.  This app should be getting around 2MB second and is not.

author: Kasey Starnes
comment: Literally ads every 5-10 seconds, even layering over each other. If you want ads in your app, fine. But don't make your app unusable because of them. Ugh. It wouldn't transfer the files for me either.

author: Josh Wong
comment: Was awesome. Now gets stuck in weird ad loops. See the same ad every few seconds. Also forcibly reorients the screen...very annoying

author: Roberto Estivill
comment: Very nice app. Sync works just fine between phone and watch. Bluetooth headphones buttons don't work when playing from Android Wear device. Also the interface for smartwatch is pretty bad for the size of the screen.

author: James Miller
comment: File transfer kept getting errors.  Shuffle was only within one folder...whats the point if music transfers one folder per music artist??  Has potential but not very user friendly.  Needs to shuffle across all subfolders from one main folder and strengthen the file transers so there are fewer errors.  Also, when the app errors on a file transfer, the phone needs to be restarted in order to begin transferring again and the app adds duplicate files to transfer.

author: Angad Singh
comment: I'm using this app on my Moto 360 2nd gen and I uninstalled it because it keeps crashing my SmartWatch after it Play 3 songs. On the third song it appears to be playing but you can't hear it or doesn't play. And after a few seconds of crashes the watch. Forces a reboot please fix. Running Android Wear 2.0

author: Anindya Das
comment: Just ok but not too good. Each time they force to upgrade to paid version.I get better sound in google play music.

author: Abel Alba
comment: It's super glitchy on my moto360 2nd gen. If I skip to many songs it'll freeze or disable my Bluetooth forcing me to reboot the device.

author: Andrew Smith
comment: Simple to use. Works well. Currently works better for listening to podcasts offline on a standalone Android Wear watch than any dedicated podcast app I've been able to find!

author: Colin MacDonald
comment: The best app for coping media to my Android Wear watch, just wish copying was a bit faster. I imagine this is a hardware limitation by my watch has WiFi and it would be great if this could be used to speed up transfer. Great work either way.

author: Tanya Bitzan
comment: This app is simply AMAZING in that it does Almost all the things I need in a wear music player.   This sound player stands above the rest because does nearly everything that I need. These are the features that work and I really appreciate:  - Easily sync sound files from phone to app  - Easily browse through sound files on watch  - The app resumes a file in the same spot where it previously had stopped playing   - The app has a ff/rw option to skip around within the sound file    Yes there are ads in the free version of the app, but I find them acceptable.  I do not use the image section of the app so have no comments on that part.  In a perfect world (and maybe in the future, as I will be suggesting the developer add these) the app would also include these features:   - I cannot ff/rw songs with my Bluedio bluetooth headphone forward/backward buttons  - I cannot delete sound files I am done with from the watch app  - I cannot delete sound files from the phone app from either the watch or the phone (instead I have to use the phone's file manager app)

author: Terry Lobo
comment: Exactly what I was looking for to copy/play music on my Zenwatch 3 speaker. Ads did not interfere too much with free version but I still opted for the paid version.

This is the only app I know of that lets you transfer music and podcasts to an android wear watch for playing music with Bluetooth headphones without your phone. It works perfectly, exactly as I would want it to work. It has a nice file browser that lets you copy files from anywhere on your phone and put them anywhere on your watch. Also, it's the only music app for Android wear watch that lets you fast forward and rewind tracks right on the watch.

author: Nik Brooks
comment: Well it has taken me ages to figure out how to use the application and with the help of the internet I figured out how it works.  Now I am really impressed with it and looking forward to adding more stuff to my watch. Please could you do a clearer tutorial and maybe post it on YouTube so others can enjoy this application without any frustration.

author: Wozzy G
comment: Absolutely fantastic solution for those of you like me have been pulling hair out with loading music on your Sony Smartwatch 3. Great App that has already lowered my blood pressure significantly. Well done!

author: Brent Mcdonald
comment: It took me awhile but I moved almost 1 Gigabyte music from my phone to my watch so I could listen to it while I work out.  Program is glitchy and unstable

author: D zooswanko
comment: I never rate apps but this is genius because not even google was able to come up with this yet. Screw the play music app shenanigans. Use this app to transfer music right from your phone

author: Kyle Tackett
comment: Worked OK until today.  I either have connection issues or the file won't transfer...

author: Dan Raines
comment: Is there a way to group each separate download into a single file for continuous play? It works well other than having to cycle through different files instead of one big on marked music.

author: Rob Simpson
comment: Pretty poor app to be honest - takes ages to transfer anything & stops when screen goes off which corrupts transferred files.
Its really bad I want to download music to my gallery and it doesn't let' me do anything like that

author: Diana Parsons
comment: Unable to locate podcasts from another app that can be copied into this app. Uninstalling

author: oh really
comment: Awful app couldn't even get 1 song to play
Is there a way to prevent sound in this app continuing in the background during phone calls?

author: Brandon Hughes
comment: It's pretty good. Only decent music app for Wear. No doubt could be better but I understand that Wear is pretty weak in and of itself.

author: Vicky War
comment: I love the app I was struggling to play music on my fossil thx a lot wish u make some great time with feature update👌👌
Finally .. an app that will let me play music directly on my Sony SW3 without having to use Google Music Player. Works perfectly!

author: Shelby J
comment: It keeps saying to connect my watch but it is connected.

author: Francis Pham
comment: The Best file manager, image viewer, and music player for Android Wear!

author: Francois Nguyen
comment: It's the only file manager that works on Android Wear 2.0 devices. That alone makes the app worth at least 5 stars!

author: David Atkinson
comment: Works well but WAY too many ads

author: Lotfi Jabber
comment: Good but transfer is way to slow. Would purchase of speeds were faster than 120kbs

author: Drew W
comment: the hotspot portion of this app did not work

author: Silviu Broasca
comment: E ok pt android wear 2, nu am dat 5 stele deoarece e putin intuitiva !

author: Teh Dyzaster
comment: File Manager crashes often, I wish it supported video, other then that its awesome

author: Ray Dar
comment: When I "Share" a media file from an app, Wear Media should be one of the choices, but it's not.

author: Luis Casanova
comment: It works. Not very intuitive.

author: Allant Ching
comment: When out of Wifi coverage during transfer, it can't be restarted. Workaround - restart the watch.
